pr_title: Cleanup delegation for JdbcClient statistics and caching

timeline.bodyText: if you keep delegate (as private), the diff will be small & nice
timeline.author: findepi

replies.bodyText: I thought about that, but keeping a useless method just to make the diff nice seems lame. (and you know how much I like nice diffs)
replies.author: electrum

replies.bodyText: I updated it to keep the method
replies.author: electrum

timeline.bodyText:
I would rather delegate explicitly. And ensure it delegates everything with testEverythingImplemented.
This will ensure that if we add a new method (like schemaexists(ConnectorSesson, String) overload), this class will get updated properly.
So IMO this class should be impl the same way the StatisticsAware class is -- it has the same design principles of overriding everything except handed-picked exceptions (if any)
timeline.author: findepi
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -46,7 +38,7 @@
 import static java.util.Objects.requireNonNull;
 
 public class CachingJdbcClient
-        implements JdbcClient
+        extends ForwardingJdbcClient

replies.bodyText: This was done this way in purpose. Please undo this commit.
replies.author: kokosing

replies.bodyText: It's not possible to delegate schemaExists as the default implementation in the delegated would call getSchemaNames() on itself, thus bypassing the cache. We'd need some way to specify exceptions for assertAllMethodsOverridden(). But doing that and being explicit does seem better.
replies.author: electrum

timeline.bodyText:
isLimitGuaranteed stats are not useful
this method does not take any args, so it is not possible that it is not O(1) call
i would rather not have these stats, not to litter the JMX state
timeline.author: findepi

timeline.bodyText:
supportsLimit stats are not useful
this method does not take any args, so it is not possible that it is not O(1) call
i would rather not have these stats, not to litter the JMX state
timeline.author: findepi

timeline.bodyText: I haven't added them in purpose. Such methods do not need to be measured.
timeline.author: kokosing

replies.bodyText:
Makes sense. We can implement them as a pure delegate so assertAllMethodsOverridden passes (and we know if we miss any future methods).
Should we keep it for getSystemTable? That could potentially read table metadata. (though that would need to do it internally and bypass any cache...)
replies.author: electrum

timeline.author: kokosing

timeline.message: Ensure CachingJdbcClient delegates all unhandled methods
Ensure CachingJdbcClient delegates all unhandled methods
